alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ulster and west central Dutchess Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marlboro, or near Poughkeepsie, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Poughkeepsie, New Paltz, Hyde Park, Pleasant Valley, Wappingers Falls, Highland, Fairview, Marlboro, Red Oaks Mill, Myers Corner, High Falls, Tillson, Lloyd, Tuckers Corner, Salt Point, Knapps Corner, Elting Corners, Haviland, Stoneco and Colonial Heights. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
